concept.deftn: The name of an occurrence or occasion that contributes to or results in the creation or presentation of the item being submitted.

bestPractices.practice: This field is required for all conference proceedings articles, posters and presentations/webcasts.
Enter the name of the event at which the resource was presented, shown, created or distributed.
As you type, event names will be suggested by the system. If the event you are entering is not in this vocabulary, it will be added after verification.
When constructing new event names, start with the number of the conference, the full name of the conference, and in parentheses, any abbreviation used to reference the event. See the examples below.
Title case the words of an event name. That is, always capitalize the first word of the name and capitalize all other words except words like the, for, of, and, on, in, a, etc.
Capitalize proper nouns, chemical abbreviations, instrument and model abbreviations.
Separate the event title and the event subtitle with a colon.
Do not end the event name with any form of punctuation, unless it is part of the name itself.
Example: World Weather Research Program Symposium on Nowcasting and Very-short Range Forecasting
Example: 6th European Conference on Radar in Meteorology and Hydrology (ERAD 2010))
